text: Biphasic control of nuclear factor-kappa B activation by the T cell receptor complex : role of <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The regulation of nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappa B activation by the T cell receptor ( TcR ) / CD3 complex in primary human T cells has been studied at various times after activation .

Only <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> NF-kappa B protein bound the kappa B element of <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 receptor (IL-2R) alpha chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter on resting T cells .

text: Interestingly , all those early and late events , but not the immediate ones , were inhibited by a neutralizing anti - <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) monoclonal antibody .

Similarly , cycloheximide prevented the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> translocation and consequent formation of active binding heterodimers , at early and late times .

text: Cyclosporin A impaired not only early and late , but also immediate events ; however , addition of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> prevented all inhibition .

These results indicate that the regulation of NF-kappa B activation during T cell activation by TcR / CD3 signals is biphasic : TcR / CD3 triggers its immediate translocation , which is transient if no <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is present .

<extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , therefore , emerges as the main factor responsible for a second phase of NF-kappa B regulation , controlling both translocation of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and new mRNA synthesis for <extra_id_0> c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
